ovdesc.p: This screen is used to define different clearing used for the payment settlements in the payments hub.
The generic setup is as per clearing (including RTGS) and currency.
Example: Clearing code of the company, BIC of the clearing and its corresponding clearing code.
A record authorised in this screen will create or amend or reverse a record in store table, PPT.CLEARING.

desc.p: Unique ID generated by the payments hub in order to identify each record in the application.
Used for internal purpose. Holds the ID of the previous live record of store table.
This field can hold upto 65 alphanumeric characters and the value is not editable by the user.

Contains all the override messages which the user agreed to during Input. During the validation of a transaction, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly.
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.
The value is not editable by the user.
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
The value is not editable by the user.
Distinguishes between a RTGS and a clearing while mapping the credit parties to their party roles.
This field will be set to 'Y' if clearing is an RTGS.
This field will be set to 'N' if clearing is not an RTGS.
Indicates Sender BICCode which to be mentioned in the SWIFT outgoing messages.
35 alphanumeric characters.Value links to field 'BICCode' in PPT.BICTABLE.
Distinguishes if RMA check is performed or not
This field will be set to 'Y' if RMA checked.
This field will be set to 'N' if RMA not checked.
